channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thousands of federal employees are getting laid off. Will a judge intervene?
item.description: Unions representing federal employees have asked a federal judge in San Francisco to halt the Trump administration's latest round of layoffs, which ar...

item.title: Scientists are modifying wildlife DNA. Should these species be released into nature?
item.description: Scientists are researching ways to genetically modify plants and animals to be more resistant to threats like climate change. The IUCN is voting on wh...

item.title: In rural America, scarce doctors battle misinformation as they practice medicine
item.description: Conspiracy theories about health fill a vacuum created by the lack of doctors in many rural communities. Meanwhile, doctors in these areas say patient...

item.title: U.S. charges Cambodian tycoon in massive alleged cryptocurrency scam
item.description: In an indictment unsealed in federal court, U.S. prosecutors charge the founder of a Cambodian conglomerate in a massive cryptocurrency scam, bilking ...

item.title: Israel keeps Gaza border crossing closed while reducing aid deliveries
item.description: The ceasefire on Wednesday was largely holding, although Hamas described Israeli attacks in Gaza as violations of the agreement.

item.title: Meta scraps Facebook page tracking ICE agents in Chicago, at DOJ's request
item.description: Meta has removed a Facebook page used to track the presence of immigration agents at the request of the Department of Justice, the company confirmed o...

item.title: Trump officials back firm in fight over California offshore oil drilling after huge spill
The government shutdown is putting a renewed spotlight on the cracks in the US aviation system
'Father of our democracy': Kenya's Raila Odinga dies in India aged 80
item.description: Odinga unsuccessfully ran for the presidency five times but shared power several times.

item.title: Hostage families confirm identities of three of four bodies handed over by Hamas
item.description: Hamas has yet to return 21 hostages' bodies as agreed under a ceasefire deal brokered by the US.

item.title: Bangladesh garment factory fire kills at least 16
item.description: The dead have been burned beyond recognition and officials have warned that the toll could rise.

item.title: Storm decimates 2 Alaskan villages and drives more than 1,500 people from their homes
item.description: Officials in Alaska are rushing to find housing for people from tiny coastal villages devastated by the remnants of Typhoon Halong.

item.title: Guns, drugs worth $170 million seized in raid linked to "kill team" hit
item.description: Police images showed drug packages emblazoned with a picture of a cartoon bear from the 2012 comedy "Ted." Another bag featured Chinese characters rea...

item.title: Bowen: Trump's role in Gaza ceasefire was decisive, but not a roadmap to peace
item.description: Trump's Middle East visit was a victory lap - but peace does not emerge just because a president decides it.

item.title: 9/10: CBS Morning News
item.description: Poland says it shot down Russian drones that entered its airspace during Russian attack on Ukraine; Major U.S. jobs revisions point to weak labor mark...

item.title: At least 20 dead in bus fire on highway in India, police say
item.description: At least 20 people were killed in a bus fire on a highway in western India, police say, adding that a jammed door kept many passengers from escaping.

item.title: NYC mayoral hopeful Sliwa blasts Mamdani and Cuomo, urges Trump to stay out of race

item.title: 'He transformed R&B forever' - Stars pay tribute to D’Angelo, after his death at 51
item.description: The Grammy-winning singer, who died of cancer, "transformed R&B forever", says Beyoncé.
